1.Pros: Flexible hours, cool people, free food
1.Cons: No rewards, no incentives, and the customers

2.Pros: Flexible schedule. Good hours. Opportunities for a higher position.
2.Cons: I really like it there I have nothing bad to say.

3.Pros: Wakes you from the dead at 1 o'clock in the morning with the sense of urgency to take a unpoopable dookie

4.Pros: Raises, work with great people, always room for promotions.
4.Cons: Sometimes work past your shift, sometimes don't get a break, depending on who the shift Manager is you won't get all your hours, they can send you home after only working two hours of business is slow.

5.Pros: It paid you weekly and free food.
5.Cons: The hours were unreasonable and too much work.

6.Pros: Hire young people with no experience, obtain work history, difficult start
6.Cons: low pay, no employee discount, work just shy of full time.

7.Summary: "Great as a Teenager but if you're an overachiever then they'll overwork you"
7.Pros: If they like you you'll get a lot of hours (though still be part time because you were "Scheduled" for 38 even if you worked 46)Job ExperienceCoworkers were nice and some sense of community
7.Cons: Low Pay and Fast paced environment - really high stress if you care about giving the best service, for those who don't care so much they seem to do really great there.

8.Pros: The fries there are always truly a blessing. plus getting to eat the food is amazing. always love doing that.
8.Cons: smell of mcdonald’s fries being ruined seems to happen after you work there for a while. be warned cause i loved their fries.

9.Cons: Lots of work in a hot place
